paper.title: Remote Sensing and Archaeological Prospection: Apulia, Italy

pass_a_accuracy.methodology: Systematic sampling (20%) + complete RDMAP review + targeted high-risk items

issues.description: Missing claim ID without consolidation note or explanation
Missing claim ID without consolidation note or explanation

strengths: Sophisticated and appropriate typing for evidence and claims
weaknesses: Minor interpretive extension in C034 (appropriately typed)

pass_b_granularity.methodology: Complete review of all 288 items for splitting/consolidation appropriateness

issues.description: Slight conceptual overlap in MTS comparative dataset description, but acceptable given emphasis differences

strengths: Excellent consolidation judgment (19 consolidations maintain accuracy)
Complex quantitative consolidations without detail loss
patterns: Claims: Aggressive but accurate consolidation for quantitative results
RDMAP: Appropriate abstraction levels throughout hierarchy

pass_c_mapping.score_note: 89.7% accounts for all relationships including 16 unmapped claims; 96.7% evaluates only mapped relationships
pass_c_mapping.methodology: Complete review of 128 claim→evidence + 37 RDMAP hierarchy mappings

incorrect_mappings.description: E022 about QuickBird resolution doesn't support claim about survey data as ideal test case

weak_mappings.description: E009 provides example but doesn't directly state 'pressing need'
E065 states thresholds but not rationale about differential production
E069 doesn't confirm sufficiency of grab sampling
E081 doesn't confirm sufficiency judgment for coverage

issues.unmapped_pattern: Predominantly Discussion/Conclusions claims (methodological recommendations, synthesis statements) lacking explicit evidence mappings

strengths: Strong empirical claim support (96.1% of mapped relationships)
Complex consolidated claims maintain evidence linkages
weaknesses: 4 weak mappings where evidence states facts but not interpretive conclusions
Some authorial synthesis recommendations lack evidential grounding
patterns: Results section claims: Near-perfect evidence support

overall_assessment.grade_rationale: Excellent extraction quality with minor issues: near-perfect accuracy (99.6%), excellent granularity (99.7%), and strong mapping quality for empirical content (96.7% of mapped relationships), with mapping completeness issue for discussion/conclusions (89.7% overall mapping score)
overall_assessment.calculation_note: Pass A weighted 40% (extraction quality foundation), Pass B weighted 20% (granularity supports usability), Pass C weighted 40% (mapping quality critical for verification)
key_strengths: Excellent consolidation quality (19 consolidations maintain accuracy)
Perfect RDMAP hierarchy extraction and mapping
Strong support for all empirical findings
improvement_recommendations: Add evidence mappings for discussion/conclusion claims (synthesis and recommendations)
Document or remove unexplained ID gaps (C002, C026)
Consider strengthening weak mappings with additional evidence

patterns.error_concentration: Issues isolated to Discussion/Conclusions section unmapped claims
patterns.data_quality: High overall, with minor ID gap issues
patterns.methodological_transparency: Excellent - comprehensive RDMAP extraction enables full replicability assessment

comparison_to_reference.comparison: Ross extraction slightly higher quality (+0.5 points)
notes: Ross has fewer extraction errors (2 vs 5 ID issues)
Ross has lower mapping completeness (88.1% vs 94.2% claims mapped)
Both show concentration of unmapped claims in Discussion/Conclusions
Both have perfect RDMAP hierarchy extraction

recommendations.replication_readiness: High - extraction supports full transparency assessment
recommendations.usability: Excellent - consolidations improve readability without accuracy loss

priority_fixes.issue: Document C002, C026 gaps or remove IDs

methodology_notes: Discussion/conclusion claims may need different mapping approach (synthesis evidence?)
Consider adding 'authorial_synthesis' evidence type for recommendations/conclusions
Implicit protocol documentation approach is excellent model for other extractions
